engine.mechanic: Roll 1d100 equal to or below a skill or characteristic. Difficulty levels: Regular, Hard (1/2), Extreme (1/5). Lower rolls are better.
engine.success: Results are Fumble, Failure, Regular, Hard, Extreme, or Critical (01). Compare success levels for opposed rolls.
engine.crit: A roll of 01 is a critical success. Some Keeper options treat other very low rolls as especially favorable.
engine.crit_rules: 01 is always a critical success; in opposed tests the higher success level wins.
engine.fumble: If the roll required for success is 50+ then 100 fumbles; if it is below 50 then 96–100 is a fumble.

procedures.combat: 1) Determine DEX order (highest first). 2) Each round, every combatant gets one action on their DEX rank. 3) On their turn, an investigator may attack, fire a weapon, move, or perform another significant action. 4) When attacked in melee, a target may Dodge (avoid damage) or Fight Back (counterattack); compare success levels to resolve. 5) Major wound occurs if a single attack inflicts damage equal to or greater than half maximum HP; at 0 HP a CON roll may avoid death, otherwise the investigator dies or bleeds out.
procedures.exploration: Use skill rolls (typically Regular difficulty) to search, research, climb, listen, navigate, and so on. The Keeper sets difficulty (Regular, Hard, Extreme) and states stakes before rolling. Failed rolls may sometimes be Pushed: the player describes a riskier attempt; if this second roll fails, the Keeper imposes severe consequences.
procedures.social: Use interpersonal skills (Charm, Fast Talk, Intimidate, Persuade, Psychology) to influence NPCs. The Keeper decides whether a given scene is a single roll, an opposed roll against an NPC skill/characteristic, or a series of rolls. Consequences of failure often include lost trust, closed doors, or escalating danger.
procedures.downtime: Between scenarios or during lulls, run an Investigator Development Phase: roll for checked skills to improve them, adjust Credit Rating and finances, attempt to recover Sanity through therapy or self-help tied to backstory connections, and update the investigator’s background. Long-term institutionalization or treatment can slowly restore Sanity but may impose constraints on play.

fields.label: Era
fields.usage_hint: Campaign era label (e.g. 1920s, Modern, Gaslight).

fields.label: Campaign Name
fields.usage_hint: Name of the current campaign or scenario arc.

fields.label: Occupation
fields.usage_hint: Investigator’s job or role (e.g. Antiquarian, Detective). Used mainly for flavor and chargen, not rolls.

fields.label: Age
fields.usage_hint: Biological age of the investigator.

fields.label: Gender
fields.usage_hint: Gender identity / presentation; descriptive only.

fields.label: Home Residence
fields.usage_hint: Primary place of residence (city, country, neighborhood).

fields.label: Birthplace
fields.usage_hint: Where the investigator was born.

fields.label: Strength (STR)
fields.usage_hint: Physical power; used for lifting, melee feats, and some combat maneuvers.

fields.label: Constitution (CON)
fields.usage_hint: Health and resilience; contributes to HP and resistance to disease and shock.

fields.label: Size (SIZ)
fields.usage_hint: Overall body mass and height; used with STR and CON for HP, Build, damage bonus.

fields.label: Dexterity (DEX)
fields.usage_hint: Agility and reflexes; sets combat order and underpins Dodge and many physical skills.

fields.label: Appearance (APP)
fields.usage_hint: Looks, charm, first impressions; supports some interpersonal situations.

fields.label: Intelligence (INT)
fields.usage_hint: Reasoning and insight; governs Idea-like checks and some knowledge skills.

fields.label: Power (POW)
fields.usage_hint: Willpower and spiritual resilience; defines Sanity, Magic Points and resistance to mental influence.

fields.label: Education (EDU)
fields.usage_hint: Formal learning; used as Own Language base and many academic occupations.

fields.label: Hit Points (HP)
fields.usage_hint: Physical health pool. Current HP drops from injury; at half Max HP a major wound is possible, at 0 HP the investigator may die.

fields.label: Magic Points (MP)
fields.usage_hint: Pool used to fuel spells and psychic effects; usually equals POW/5.

fields.label: Sanity (SAN)
fields.usage_hint: Mental stability. Lose SAN to unnatural shocks; at 0 SAN the investigator is permanently insane.

fields.label: Luck
fields.usage_hint: Spendable pool to turn failures into successes or avoid misfortune; usually rolled as 3d6×5 at creation.

fields.label: Major Wound
fields.usage_hint: True if the investigator has suffered a major wound (≥ half max HP in one blow). Affects healing and death checks.

fields.label: Temporary Insanity
fields.usage_hint: True if currently under effects of temporary insanity following a big SAN loss.

fields.label: Indefinite Insanity
fields.usage_hint: True if the investigator has suffered indefinite insanity and is mentally unstable for an extended period.

fields.label: Conditions
fields.usage_hint: Ad hoc tags like 'prone', 'stunned', 'bleeding', 'restrained'.

fields.label: Build
fields.usage_hint: Relative size for grappling and damage bonus; derived from STR+SIZ using the standard Build table.

fields.label: Damage Bonus
fields.usage_hint: Text like '-1d4', '0', '+1d4', '+1d6' based on STR+SIZ.

fields.label: Move Rate (MOV)
fields.usage_hint: How far the investigator can move per round; used in chases and tactical positioning.

fields.label: Weapons
fields.usage_hint: List of weapons with fields like name, skill used, damage, range, ammo, malfunction.

fields.label: Gear & Equipment
fields.usage_hint: General equipment, tools, clothing, and props the investigator carries.

fields.label: Cash & Assets
fields.usage_hint: Abstract pool for ready cash or liquid assets, often implied by Credit Rating.

fields.label: Traits & Quirks
fields.usage_hint: Distinctive personality traits with mechanical teeth (e.g. Drive, Phobia triggers, story flaws).

fields.label: Phobias & Manias
fields.usage_hint: Long-term mental disorders gained from SAN loss; each item should name the fear/mania and its typical triggers.

fields.label: Mythos Spells
fields.usage_hint: Known spells with notes on MP/SAN cost and casting requirements.

fields.label: Occupational Features
fields.usage_hint: Any special rules or advantages granted by the investigator’s occupation (licenses, contacts, institutional access).

fields.label: Allies & Friends
fields.usage_hint: Named allies, with optional notes (relation, usefulness, where they can be found).

fields.label: Contacts
fields.usage_hint: Useful acquaintances like informants, librarians, or officials.

fields.label: Enemies & Rivals
fields.usage_hint: Those actively opposed to the investigator (cultists, criminal rivals, hostile officials).

fields.label: Ideology & Beliefs
fields.usage_hint: Core worldview or philosophy; can act as a sanity anchor or roleplay driver.

fields.label: Significant People
fields.usage_hint: Named individuals important to the investigator; losing or saving them can affect SAN.

fields.label: Meaningful Locations
fields.usage_hint: Places charged with emotional significance (childhood home, battlefield, library).

fields.label: Treasured Possessions
fields.usage_hint: Items that matter deeply to the investigator; good hooks for SAN recovery or loss.

fields.label: Personality Traits
fields.usage_hint: Short descriptive phrases for personality (e.g. 'Curious to a fault', 'Skeptical rationalist').

fields.label: Backstory Summary
fields.usage_hint: Freeform summary of the investigator’s history, key events, and personal arc.

fields.label: Key Connection
fields.usage_hint: Single especially important relationship or element used for SAN recovery scenes.

fields.label: Development Checks
fields.usage_hint: Names of skills that have been used successfully and are eligible for improvement at the end of a scenario.

fields.label: Experience / Story Awards
fields.usage_hint: Optional abstract progression currency if you want to track XP-like rewards.

fields.label: Mythos Tomes Studied
fields.usage_hint: Books and sources that granted Cthulhu Mythos skill and SAN cost over long-term study.

fields.label: Accounting
fields.usage_hint: Knowledge of bookkeeping and financial records; used to spot fraud or track money.

fields.label: Anthropology
fields.usage_hint: Study of human cultures and customs; useful for interpreting rituals and social practices.

fields.label: Appraise
fields.usage_hint: Estimate value and authenticity of objects, antiques, art, and artifacts.

fields.label: Archaeology
fields.usage_hint: Excavation and interpretation of ancient sites and artifacts.

fields.label: Art/Craft (Any)
fields.usage_hint: Any artistic or craft skill; note specialization in the item (e.g. 'Art/Craft (Singing)').

fields.label: Charm
fields.usage_hint: Friendly persuasion by likability, flirtation, or warmth.

fields.label: Climb
fields.usage_hint: Scaling walls, cliffs, and obstacles.

fields.label: Credit Rating
fields.usage_hint: Social and financial standing; sets lifestyle and access to resources.

fields.label: Cthulhu Mythos
fields.usage_hint: Understanding of Mythos truths; usually gained only through play, never at creation.

fields.label: Disguise
fields.usage_hint: Altering appearance, clothing, or mannerisms to pass as someone else.

fields.label: Dodge
fields.usage_hint: Avoid incoming attacks; base is usually half DEX, but can be improved with points.

fields.label: Drive Auto
fields.usage_hint: Operating cars and trucks under stress, including chases.

fields.label: Electrical Repair
fields.usage_hint: Diagnosing and fixing electrical devices, wiring, radios, etc.

fields.label: Fast Talk
fields.usage_hint: Rapid patter and bluffing to win short-term cooperation.

fields.label: Fighting (Brawl)
fields.usage_hint: Unarmed combat and simple hand weapons like clubs.

fields.label: Firearms (Handgun)
fields.usage_hint: Using pistols and revolvers.

fields.label: Firearms (Rifle/Shotgun)
fields.usage_hint: Using rifles and shotguns.

fields.label: First Aid
fields.usage_hint: Immediate treatment of wounds; can restore a small amount of HP after injury.

fields.label: History
fields.usage_hint: Knowledge of the past, historical figures, and events.

fields.label: Intimidate
fields.usage_hint: Coercion through threat, physical presence, or menace.

fields.label: Jump
fields.usage_hint: Leaping over gaps, down from heights safely, etc.

fields.label: Language (Own)
fields.usage_hint: Native language; usually equals EDU, but can vary with Keeper approval.

fields.label: Language (Other)
fields.usage_hint: Any non-native language; specify which (e.g. French, Latin).

fields.label: Library Use
fields.usage_hint: Finding information in libraries, archives, and databases.

fields.label: Listen
fields.usage_hint: Perceiving faint sounds, eavesdropping, and general auditory awareness.

fields.label: Locksmith
fields.usage_hint: Picking locks and opening safes.

fields.label: Mechanical Repair
fields.usage_hint: Fixing mechanical devices, engines, and machinery.

fields.label: Medicine
fields.usage_hint: Professional, long-term medical care and diagnosis.

fields.label: Natural World
fields.usage_hint: Knowledge of flora, fauna, weather, and wilderness signs.

fields.label: Navigate
fields.usage_hint: Finding one’s way by maps, stars, or landmarks.

fields.label: Occult
fields.usage_hint: Knowledge of folklore, esoteric traditions, and non-Mythos occultism.

fields.label: Persuade
fields.usage_hint: Sustained, reasoned argument to change minds over time.

fields.label: Psychology
fields.usage_hint: Reading motives and emotional states; spotting lies or instability.

fields.label: Sleight of Hand
fields.usage_hint: Palming objects, pickpocketing, and stage tricks.

fields.label: Spot Hidden
fields.usage_hint: Noticing concealed details, hidden doors, or small clues.

fields.label: Stealth
fields.usage_hint: Moving quietly, hiding, and avoiding detection.

fields.label: Survival (Any)
fields.usage_hint: Living off the land in a specific environment; specify terrain (desert, arctic, etc.).

fields.label: Swim
fields.usage_hint: Swimming and staying afloat in water or other liquids.

fields.label: Throw
fields.usage_hint: Accurately throwing objects or grenades.

fields.label: Track
fields.usage_hint: Following footprints, spoor, or other signs left by creatures.

rules.name: Skill Rolls and Difficulty
rules.content: Roll 1d100 and succeed if the result is equal to or under the relevant skill or characteristic. Hard rolls require ≤ half value; Extreme rolls require ≤ one-fifth.

rules.name: Success Levels and Opposed Rolls
rules.content: Results are Fumble, Failure, Regular, Hard, Extreme, or Critical (01). In opposed tests, the highest success level wins; ties usually favor the defender or higher skill.

rules.name: Bonus and Penalty Dice
rules.content: In favorable conditions add one or more bonus dice; in poor conditions add penalty dice. Roll extra tens dice and take the best (bonus) or worst (penalty) tens result.

rules.name: Pushing Rolls
rules.content: A failed roll may be pushed once if the player describes a riskier attempt. If the pushed roll also fails, the Keeper inflicts a serious narrative or mechanical consequence.

rules.name: Sanity Loss and Insanity
rules.content: On witnessing shocks, roll Sanity; failure costs SAN in a range set by the Keeper. Losing too much at once can cause temporary or indefinite insanity; at 0 SAN the investigator is permanently insane.

rules.name: Hit Points, Major Wounds, and Death
rules.content: HP measure physical health. A single blow dealing ≥ half max HP causes a major wound. At 0 HP, a failed CON roll usually means death; successful medical care and time restore HP.

rules.name: Magic Points and Spells
rules.content: Magic Points equal POW/5 and fuel spells. Casting costs MP (and often SAN); if MP reach 0, the investigator is exhausted and may risk unconsciousness or worse.

rules.name: Luck Rolls and Spending
rules.content: Luck is rolled as 3d6×5 at creation. The Keeper may call for Luck rolls to test random fortune. Investigators may spend current Luck points to turn failures into successes, but spent points rarely return quickly.

rules.name: Combat Rounds and Options
rules.content: Combat proceeds in DEX order. In melee, the defender may Dodge or Fight Back; compare success levels. Ranged attacks often cannot be fought back, only dodged. Penalty dice apply when outnumbered or impaired.

rules.name: Investigator Development Phase
rules.content: After a scenario, roll 1d100 for each checked skill; if the roll exceeds the skill, add 1d10 points. High skills can grant SAN awards. This is also when SAN recovery and background changes are handled.
